intro: Eriophorella pumila, commonly known as the dwarf eriophorella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are usually covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered at the base of the plant. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
